DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of their health state today as related to anxiety or depression, using a 5 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Questionnaire Domain European Quality of Life Five Dimension Five Level Scale Questionnaire Health State Thermometer Scale Your Health State Today
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire._A standardized rating scale which is used as a measure of health outcome. This instrument is a descriptive system consisting of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 5 levels ranging from no problem to extreme problem or incapable, which are assessed by the patient._A scale marked off like a thermometer from 0 to 100 that is used to help people indicate how good or bad their health state is; the best state that can be imagined is marked 100 and the worst state that can be imagined is marked 0._A question asking an individual about how good or bad they rate their own health today.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to questionnaire.

Property.preferredName: European Quality of Life Five Dimension Five Level Scale Questionnaire Health State Thermometer Scale Your Health State Today
Property.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale which is used as a measure of health outcome. This instrument is a descriptive system consisting of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 5 levels ranging from no problem to extreme problem or incapable, which are assessed by the patient.:A scale marked off like a thermometer from 0 to 100 that is used to help people indicate how good or bad their health state is; the best state that can be imagined is marked 100 and the worst state that can be imagined is marked 0.:A question asking an individual about how good or bad they rate their own health today.

Concepts.longName: European Quality of Life Five Dimension Five Level Scale Questionnaire
Concepts.definition: A standardized rating scale which is used as a measure of health outcome. This instrument is a descriptive system consisting of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 5 levels ranging from no problem to extreme problem or incapable, which are assessed by the patient.

A scale marked off like a thermometer from 0 to 100 that is used to help people indicate how good or bad their health state is; the best state that can be imagined is marked 100 and the worst state that can be imagined is marked 0.
A question asking an individual about how good or bad they rate their own health today.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. wz

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numerical representation of a person's current health state as using a visual analogue reference standard (VAS) resembling a thermometer as part of the EQ-5D questionnaires.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for PRO-HRQoL as part of the Round 6 CRF Data Collection Standards. mc 2/12/15

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 4718161 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Questionnaire EQ-5D-5L Test Code Terminology
ReferenceDocuments.description: Test cods of questionnaire questions associated with the European Quality of Life Five Dimension Five Level Scale (EQ-5D-5L) for the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium (CDISC) Standard Data Tabulation Model (SDTM).
